metadata.name: The Origin
metadata.description:
“The origin of human thought is over debated and rumored to be a whisper from a foreign realm, but whispers tend to get lost in the noise of the screaming universe.” — Pink Nihilsm by Supamalaman

Most people would agree that for every beginning there is an end, but how then, do I explain the thoughts that linger infinitely along the edges of the boat that is my mind when I so often find myself lost at sea? A place where, if looking forward, the sky meets an ocean and at some point you can no longer tell the difference between the two. 

Time & time again we mistake the edge for the end when it is yet another beginning. 

A wise man once told me that there are simply more days in our lifetime than there is fortune to receive and I now understand that there are also more beginnings than there are endings and for this reason, I see fortune as more than mere luck; It is like Nature or like Love.. A redeeming force.

(A direct PDF link of Pink Nihilism will be included for the collector)
